sub-events.comment: make sure names and images are only distributed once

action.name: Load table
action.param: ",0,1,2,3,4 BattleAttackClanEnemy,X,0,X,X,X BattleConquerFortress,X,0,X,X,X BattleLiberateFortress,X,0,X,X,X MissionLiberatePass,X,0,X,X,X MissionSavePriest,X,0,X,X,X MissionDefeatRonin,X,0,X,X,X DuelCriminal,X,0,X,X,X DuelLegendaryWarrior,X,0,X,X,X HelpBattleIkkoIkki,X,X,0,0,0 HelpBattleBandits,X,X,0,0,0 HelpBattleRoninRebels,X,X,0,0,0 HelpMissionIkedaSamurai,X,X,0,0,0 MapMissionRonin,0,X,X,X,X MapMissionThieves,0,X,X,X,X MapMissionCoastalPirates,0,X,X,X,X MapDuelSamurai,0,X,X,X,X DaimyoMissionWarriorBand,0,X,X,X,X DaimyoMissionBandits,0,X,X,X,X DaimyoMissionRonin,0,X,X,X,X DaimyoDuelLegendaryWarrior,0,X,X,X,X DaimyoDuelCriminal,0,X,X,X,X"

sub-events.comment: isTraveling can be either "no", "alone", "withArmy" or "disguised" When kidnapping someone, a new key "hasHostage0" is added with the name of the hostage and "lordHostage0" with the name of the Lord whose family the hostage belongs to. The bottom 3 keys are only relevant for the Hatamoto.
hasDaughter and hasSon are counters -> for each X, a sonXName and sonXAge are added.
Params: 0 - index of dead rival, 1 - optional flag when function should automatically start the next decision.
Params: 0 - index of dead rival, 1 - optional flag when function should automatically start the next decision.
Params: text to display, MenuX, MenuY (not in but perhaps worth thinking about: Frame to use, BG to use.)

This one is for also displaying samurai images above the story text. Params: 0 - text to display, 1- MenuX, 2- MenuY, 3- index of first image to display, 4 - position of first image, e.g. 1 is left, 2 is center, 3 is right etc., (5 - index of second image to display)
Params: function to call, text to display, layer to place on.
This is an additional, optional parameter, used for passing on data to initiation events (for assassinations etc.)
Params: 0 - index of Data to display image for. If it's '999', display bride image from leader castle, 1 - X, 2 - Y.
Give the function its own name as Param(0), just in case.
